intro: Maba latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf maba, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, broad leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody, spiny capsules containing the seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks. The leaves and seeds of Maba latifolia have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
